features: STRAIGHT FROM THE DENTIST: This clinical quality mouth rinse is exactly what you’ll find your dentist using after a cleaning. It provides antimicrobial protection to your teeth and gums for up to 8 hours after every use, helping reduce tooth sensitivity and protecting against gum disease. Plus, it removes any bacterial film from your teeth, leaving them feeling better than ever.

GET A HEALTHIER SMILE: It’s not just for combatting sensitivity. This liquid mouthwash contains stannous fluoride, which helps reduce cavities, whiten teeth, fight gingivitis, reduce plaque, and repair early stages of tooth decay - leaving you with a brighter smile.

NO TOXINS: Our mouthwash formula is alcohol free, gluten free, dye free, and paraben free. On top of that, it’s sweetened with xylitol, a natural alternative to sugar, making it safe for people with diabetes and hyperglycemia.
REFRESHING FLAVOR: You won’t dread using this mouthwash. With a light, mild spearmint flavor, this dental rinse leaves your mouth feeling cleaner, fresher, and healthier.

OUR PROMISE TO YOU: No matter what, you’re backed by our 100% Satisfaction and Guarantee - either you love this product, or we’ll give back every penny. And if you have any questions or concerns, our customer support is on standby to work with you till you’re satisfied.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 20, 2022
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Good taste, good ingredients
reviews.reviewText: I found this fluoride in my quest to find one that was free of alcohol and dyes (I'd prefer no artificial sweeteners either, but considering there is likely so little and I'm not really eating it, it's less of a concern for me; unfortunately, this probably also applies to the xylitol, which is listed last in the ingredients list). I also had a slight preference for stannous fluoride over other forms, which this one also happened to meet.It's not quite as convenient as pre-diluted fluoride, but it's still pretty easy: the directions say 1/8 fl oz of this with 2 oz of water, and they provide a (plastic) cup for easy mixing. (Don't skimp on the mixing, BTW. They provide a cap to make it easy to shake, where I thought I could get by with just swirling it around and eventually discovered a layer of deposits on the bottom of the container, which I suspect there would have been less of had I mixed better, and I probably didn't get the full dose every time before I realized this.) I'd like to think it's cheaper, too, and a quick calculation of the recommended dilution rates suggest it is with a name brand I can find at the store by at least a few cents per final concentration ounce, but I still like the idea of not shipping around something that's mostly water, anyway.Speaking of shipping, I had to return/replace my first purchase--it wasn't packaged well, and the dispenser (which comes separately from the bottle in the same box), likely because the bottle shook around and crushed it during transit or delivery. The plastic cup was also broken. Amazon, as usual, was great and replaced it without issue, but it seems like they could devise better packaging for shipment to avoid this hassle.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on April 30, 2023
reviews.reviewText: Exactly what I was looking for. More people should know about this great product. I had some from the dentist years ago, but could not find anything in stores. Using a stannous fluoride toothpaste with this rinse has helped with bleeding gums and I know my teeth are protected throughout the day.
